intro: Sarcocapnos baetica subsp. baetica, commonly known as the Iberian spurge, is a perennial shrub native to southern Spain. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and milky sap. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showing adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and branched. This subspecies is of particular interest in botanical studies due to its limited distribution and ecological significance in Mediterranean ecosystems.
